alert.note: Alert for Wilcox (Alabama) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued March 27 at 8:53AM CDT until April 01 at 9:35AM CDT by NWS Mobile
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL NOON CDT TODAY... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of south central Alabama, including the following county, Wilcox. * WHEN...Until noon CDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 852 AM CDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the advisory area. Between 1 and 2 inches of rain have fallen. - Additional rainfall amounts of 1 to 2 inches are expected over the area. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Camden, Darlington, Rosebud, Ackerville, Estelle, Shawnee, Oak Hill, Neenah, Allenton, McBrydes, Caledonia, Snow Hill, Furman and Rockwest.
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
